bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: James Hamilton, Jr. was a congressman and governor of South Carolina (1830-1832); he also served as representative of Texas in 1841 and was senator-elect at the time of his death; he drowned following the collision of steamships Galveston and Opelousas in 1857.
